citeinfo.othercit: In lower right margin: Sea Isle City, N.J. Mapped by the Army Map Service, edited and published by the Geological Survey. "This map is for visual purposes, for detailed analysis refer to the original sources." Blue line copy. This map is sheet 15 of a series of nineteen sheets.

descript.abstract: A scanned historical New Jersey Department of Environmental Protection shown at a scale of 1:24,000.
descript.purpose: The purpose is to view the map in digital format.

idinfo.useconst: Data set is not for use in litigation.

citeinfo.title: New Jersey Geological Survey Atlas Sheets
A Topographic Map of the Vicinity of Trenton: New Brunswick and Bordentown

serinfo.sername: New Jersey Geological Survey Atlas Sheets

procstep.procdesc: The historical New Jersey Geological Atlas Sheets was originally scanned at 600 dpi using an Altek VIDAR large format scanner. The scanned map was saved in a single layer tiff format at 16 million colors. Color correction and adaptive color level balancing was done in Adobe Photoshop 6.0. This process was done at the New Jersey Environmental Digital Library (NJEDL) , Rutgers University. The original maps were FTP in TIFF LZW format from the New Jersey Digital Environmental Library (NJDEL) to the Digital Map and Geospatial Information Center, Princeton University Library. Later The TIFF LZW file was opened in the IrfanView software, version 3.80 and resaved as non-compressed TIFF file. The TIFF file was georeferenced first using ArcView 3.2a Image Analysis software. On each map, the four corners and two middle graticules were used to georeference the maps, and later the TIFF file was reprojected to the New Jersey State Plane Coordinate System, NAD 83 using ERDAS IMAGINE software 8.6.
